data.name: AbandonedWarehouses
data.value: 1. A player cannot have more commodities than their commodity value.

data.name: AccretionEngine
AchieveSupremacy
data.value: 1. The flagship or war sun may be in the home system of an eliminated player.

data.name: AdaptNewStrategies
data.value: 1. A Valefar Assimilator technology will count if it is currently copying another player’s faction technology.

data.name: AIDevelopmentAlgorithm
data.value:
1. When exhausted, a prerequisite will be ignored, and AI Development Algorithm will still count towards meeting a warfare technology (red) prerequisite.
    1. For example, AI Development Algorithm alone may be used to research the Destroyer II unit upgrade.

data.name: Alliance
data.value:
1. An Alliance must be played by the receiving player as soon as it is received. It cannot be kept secret.
    1. If the active player receives an Alliance, they cannot then attempt to trade it with another player. It must be played immediately.
  2. Alliance is returned when the system is activated, even if the active player will perform no hostile acts towards the other player this turn.
  3. If an effect other than activating a system during a tactical action places a command counter in a system with the other player’s units (for example, the primary ability of the Diplomacy strategy card), this will not cause Alliance to be returned.
  4. Activating a system containing only a player’s structures will still cause their Alliance to be returned.
  5. For notes about a commander of a specific faction, see that faction’s notes page.

data.name: AMassWealth
data.value:
1. The influence, resources and trade goods must be spent during the status phase. Any that were spent during the action phase will have no effect.
  2. A planet may be exhausted to spend either its resource or influence value, but not both.
  3. Trade goods may be spent as influence or resources when scoring Amass Wealth.

data.name: AncientBurialSites
data.value:
1. Ancient Burial Sites is played before the first agenda is revealed.
  2. A player with zero cultural planets may be chosen.

data.name: AncientShipyard
AntiIntellectualRevolution
data.value:
1. When Anti–Intellectual Revolution is a law in play, a player that directly gains a technology will be unaffected.
    1. The Nekro player is never affected by the Anti–Intellectual Revolution law.
  2. The Nekro player’s Valefar Assimilator technologies count for the “Against” effect, whether their tokens are on another player’s faction technology or not.
  3. A player with no non–fighter ships on the game board may still research technology when Anti–Intellectual Revolution is a law in play.
  4. A player may only exhaust planets they control for the “Against” effect of Anti–Intellectual Revolution.

data.name: AntimassDeflectors
data.value: 1. The −1 applies to space cannon rolls during both the Space Cannon Offense and Space Cannon Defense steps.

data.name: ArcaneCitadel
ArchaeologicalExpedition
data.value: 1. A player must control at least one planet with a trait to play and resolve Archaeological Expedition.

data.name: ArchivedSecret
data.value:
1. A player with three scored secret objectives may draw a fourth. However, they must immediately shuffle it into the secret objective deck.
  2. If a player draws the Drive the Debate secret objective while resolving Archived Secret, they cannot score it immediately.

data.name: ArmedForcesStandardization
ArmsReduction
ArticlesOfWar
AssassinateRepresentative
data.value: 1. The chosen player may still play rider cards.

data.name: AssaultCannon
data.value:
1. A player with Assault Cannon must mandatorily resolve its ability if they meet the requirement.
  2. If a player loses ships before they can resolve the Assault Cannon ability, they will be unable to resolve it if they no longer have three or more non–fighter ships.
    1. This will most commonly happen when both players in a combat have Assault Cannon, and the defender has exactly three non–fighter ships.
    2. Examples of other abilities that may remove units at the start of a space combat include the Creuss player’s Dimensional Splicer faction technology ability, the Mentak player’s Ambush faction ability, the Yin player’s Impulse Core faction technology ability, as well as abilities such as the Courageous to the End action card or the Reflective Shielding action card that may trigger off of any of the previous abilities.
  3. A player may use an ability to add ships at the start of combat. If this brings the number of non–fighter ships to three or more, the player may then use the ability of Assault Cannon.
    1. Each other player may use one ability after that player has gained ships, and before that player has the opportunity to use the Assault Cannon ability. This may prevent that player from using the ability, as above.
    2. Examples of abilities that may add units at the start of space combat include a combination of the Mentak player’s Sleeper Cell hero ability and their Ambush faction ability, the ability of the Nekro player’s flagship, The Alastor, and the Naaz–Rokha player’ Eidolon mech ability.
  4. Effects that cancel hits, such as Sustain Damage, cannot be used to prevent ships from being destroyed.

data.name: AzdelsKey
BecomeALegend
data.value:
1. The number of units in the system is irrelevant, if there is at least one.
  2. A ship, ground force, or structure will all qualify for Become a Legend.
    1. If one player has a ground force or structure on a planet in a qualifying system, and another player has a ship in the same system, both players may count the system towards the requirements of Become a Legend.
    2. A player may have ships in the system containing a legendary planet or Mecatol Rex without controlling the planet for that system to count towards the requirements of Become a Legend.
  3. If Mirage is placed in an anomaly, or the Nano–Forge relic is attached to a planet in an anomaly, that system will only count as one system towards the requirements of Become a Legend.
  4. Any system containing a Vuil’raith player’s Dimensional Tear is a gravity rift, and thus, an anomaly.
    1. If a Vuil’raith player’s Dimensional Tear is in a system containing another anomaly, a legendary planet, or Mecatol Rex, that system will only count as one system towards the requirements of Become a Legend.

data.name: BecomeAMartyr
data.value:
1. The lost planet may be in any player’s home system. It does not have to be a planet in the home system of the player scoring Become a Martyr.
    1. The lost planet may be in the home system of an eliminated player.
  2. If the lost planet is the last planet a player controls, that player will be eliminated before they score Become a Martyr, if they meet the other requirements for elimination.
  3. If the player with the Shard of the Throne relic loses their home system, they will lose the Shard of the Throne card and the associated victory point before they may score Become a Martyr.
  4. The attacker will have the opportunity to score a secret objective before the defender has the opportunity to score Become a Martyr.

data.name: BecomeTheGatekeeper
data.value:
1. A player with a ship in the wormhole nexus, or in any other system with both an alpha and beta wormhole, qualifies for Become the Gatekeeper.
  2. Any ground forces or structures are irrelevant.

data.name: BetrayAFriend
data.value:
1. The following promissory notes qualify for scoring Betray a Friend:
    1. Alliance.
    2. Support for the Throne.
    3. Stymie (Arborec).
    4. Trade Convoys (Hacan).
    5. Dark Pact (Empyrean).
    6. Blood Pact (Empyrean).
    7. Promise of Protection (Mentak).
    8. Gift of Prescience (Naalu).
    9. Antivirus (Nekro).
    10. Terraform (Ul).
  2. The defender cannot score Betray a Friend.

data.name: BioStims
BioticResearchFacility
Blitz
data.value: 1. If the L1Z1X player plays Blitz, they may use the gained Bombardment ability of each of their non–fighter ships in the system when resolving their Harrow faction ability during that invasion.

data.name: BraveTheVoid
data.value:
1. Any system containing a Vuil’raith player’s Dimensional Tear is a gravity rift, and thus, an anomaly.
  2. A wormhole is not an anomaly.

data.name: Bribery
data.value:
1. Bribery may be played after the speaker has abstained, or would vote if they are unable to.
  2. A player may spend zero trade goods when they play Bribery.
  3. A player must have cast votes for an outcome to play Bribery, and the additional votes must be cast for the same outcome.
  4. The speaker may play Distinguished Councilor after another player plays Bribery.
  5. Bribery is played before any effects that change the outcome of an agenda.

data.name: BuildDefenses
Bunker
data.value:
1. The modifier will apply to bombardment rolls for each planet in the active system.
  2. The modifier will apply to bombardment rolls made for the L1Z1X player’s Harrow faction ability during that invasion.

data.name: Ceasefire
data.value:
1. The active player may still use the Space Cannon ability of any units during the Space Cannon Offense step of the tactical action.
  2. If a player has units in the active system from before the tactical action in which their Ceasefire is played, those units will remain in the active system.
  3. If the active player already has units with capacity in the active system, they may transport ground forces on planets in that system into the space area of that system. Those units may then be committed to invade a planet during this tactical action.
  4. If a system containing only a player’s ground forces or structures is activated, that player may still play the active player’s Ceasefire.
  5. Ceasefire does not prevent a player from producing or placing units in the active system.

data.name: CentralizeGalacticTrade
data.value: 1. The trade goods must be spent during the status phase. Any trade goods that were spent during the action phase will have no effect.

data.name: ChecksAndBalances
data.value:
1. If there are any trade goods on a chosen strategy card while Checks and Balances is a law in play, the player who chose the strategy card gains them, not the player who receives that card.
  2. The Public Disgrace action card may be played after a player has chosen a strategy card and announced which player will be receiving it. The player must choose a different strategy card, and then choose the same or a different player to receive it.

data.name: ClandestineOperations
data.value: 1. If the “For” effect of Clandestine Operations is resolved, the removed tokens may be from any pool or pools on a player’s command sheet.

data.name: ClassifiedDocumentLeaks
data.value:
1. If Classified Document Leaks is revealed when only one secret objective is in play, players may only vote for that secret objective or abstain. If no votes are cast, the speaker must decide for that secret objective to be elected.
    1. Players may still play riders if only one secret objective has been scored.
  2. The player that originally owned the secret objective elected by Classified Document Leaks cannot score it again after it becomes a public objective.
  3. The elected secret objective no longer counts towards the original player’s limit of three secret objectives.
  4. If Classified Document Leaks is discarded, the elected secret objective is not returned to the original player, and it is no longer scorable as a public objective. It remains in play, not discarded.
  5. A player can score a maximum of one objective of any type during or after each combat. A player cannot score the elected objective and one of their own secret objectives from the same combat.
  6. The elected objective becomes a public objective and stops being a secret objective.
    1. If Classified Document Leaks is elected by Miscount Disclosed, the objective that was originally elected will remain a public objective during the vote. It therefore cannot be re–elected.
    2. If there are no other secret objectives eligable to be elected by the Miscount Disclosed revote, Classified Document Leaks will be discarded, and another agenda will be revealed and voted on.

data.name: ColonialRedistribution
data.value:
1. If the player that originally controlled the elected planet has the fewest victory points, they may choose themselves to place an infantry on that planet.
  2. If the elected planet has the Demilitarized Zone exploration card attached, no infantry will be placed on it. Control of the planet will remain with the original player.

data.name: CommandAnArmada
CommitteeFormation
data.value:
1. Committee Formation is resolved after any riders have been played, if the owner so chooses. Riders will resolve if the predicted outcome matches the player elected by the effect of Committee Formation.
    1. The owner of Committee Formation may play riders before they resolve Committee Formation.
  2. The Confusing Legal Text and Confounding Legal Text action cards may be played after Committee Formation has been discarded to change who the elected player is, which will negate the effects of Committee Formation.
    1. The Deadly Plot action card may be played after Committee Formation has been discarded to discard the agenda without resolving it, but only if that player predicted a different outcome from some other game effect.

data.name: CompensatedDisarmament
data.value:
1. All trade goods are gained together.
  2. Each destroyed infantry will provide one trade good and each destroyed mech will provide one trade good.
  3. A planet with zero units on it is eligible to be elected.
  4. Structures are unaffected by Compensated Disarmament.
    1. The Titans of Ul’s Hel–Titans are also ground forces and are thus affected by Compensated Disarmament.

data.name: ConfoundingLegalText
data.value:
1. Any predictions made on the outcome of the agenda resolve based on the newly elected player.
  2. Confounding Legal Text is played after any effects that allow a player to cast additional votes.
  3. Confounding Legal Text is played before Deadly Plot is played, before revealing hidden agenda for the Covert Legislation agenda, and before the Drive the Debate objective may be scored.
  4. Confounding Legal Text may be played after Confusing Legal Text is played.

data.name: ConfusingLegalText
data.value:
1. Any predictions made on the outcome of the agenda resolve based on the newly elected player.
  2. Confusing Legal Text is played after any effects that allow a player to cast additional votes.
  3. Confusing Legal Text is played before Deadly Plot is played, before revealing hidden agenda for the Covert Legislation agenda, and before the Drive the Debate objective may be scored.
  4. Confusing Legal Text may be played after Confounding Legal Text is played.

data.name: ConquerTheWeak
data.value: 1. The planet may be in the home system of an eliminated player.

data.name: ConstructionRider
data.value:
1. After playing a Construction Rider, a player may use additional abilities, including playing other rider cards.
    1. Any other riders may be played to predict the same or a different outcome.
  2. The effect of a successful Construction Rider will be resolved after the effect of the agenda.
  3. A player who cannot vote may still play a Construction Rider.
  4. If a player wishes to place a space dock, but there are none left in their reinforcements, they may remove a space dock from any system that does not contain one of their command tokens and place that instead.
  5. The Saar player may play a Construction Rider, and may place a space dock in a system containing a planet they control if successful.
  6. If a player successfully resolves a Construction Rider while they own the Minister of Industry law, they use the Production ability of their units in the system where they place their space dock. They may exhaust planets for resources, but those planets cannot be used to cast votes for the remainder of the agenda phase.

data.name: ConstructMassiveCities
ControlTheBorderlands
data.value:
1. The number of units in the system is irrelevant, if there is at least one.
  2. A ship, ground force, or structure will all qualify for Control the Borderlands.
    1. If one player has a ground force or structure on a planet in a qualifying system, and another player has a ship in the same system, both players may count the system towards the requirements of Control the Borderlands.
  3. The units may be in another player’s home system.
  4. The Creuss Gate is not a home system.
  5. The Wormhole Nexus and the Creuss home system are both on the edge of the game board.
  6. If the edge of a system tile is touching a hyperlane tile, that edge does not cause that system tile to be on the edge of the game board.
    1. When using the five– and seven–player hyperlane setups, the system tile in the center of the ring of hyperlanes is not on the edge of the game board.
    2. When using the seven– and eight–player alternate setups, only the system tiles designated as “Ring 3”, and home systems are on the edge of the game board, along with the Creuss home system and the wormhole nexus.

data.name: ControlTheRegion
data.value: 1. Any ground forces or structures are irrelevant.

data.name: ConventionsOfWar
data.value: 1. When Conventions of War is a law in play a player may still use the Tactical Bombardment action card, the X–89 Bacterial Weapon technology or the Stellar Converter relic on a cultural planet.

data.name: CoreMine
CoreMining
data.value: 1. A planet with zero infantry on it may be elected.

data.name: CornerTheMarket
CouncilPreserve
Counterstroke
CoupDetat
data.value: 1. The active player may still use any “at the end of your turn” abilities.

data.name: CourageousToTheEnd
data.value:
1. Any combat roll modifiers will not apply to the dice roll for Courageous to the End.
  2. Effects that cancel hits, such as Sustain Damage, cannot be used to prevent ships from being destroyed.

data.name: CovertLegislation
data.value:
1. If the Speaker draws Classified Document Leaks, Judicial Abolishment, Miscount Disclosed or New Constitution, when that agenda would be discarded if revealed, both the hidden agenda and Covert Legislation are discarded.
  2. Any effects that take place when or after an agenda is revealed instead take place when or after the speaker has drawn and announced the possible outcomes for the hidden agenda.
  3. If an effect, such as the Veto action card, would discard Covert Legislation, both it and the hidden agenda are discarded.
  4. The hidden agenda is only revealed as it is resolved. All abilities that may be played after voting, such as the Bribery, Confounding Legal Text, Confusing Legal Text or Deadly Plot action cards, must be played before the agenda is revealed.
  5. The speaker may still vote on Covert Legislation.

data.name: CrippleDefenses
data.value: 1. The chosen planet may have zero PDS on it.

data.name: CulturalRelicFragment
data.value:
1. If the relic deck is empty, a player may still purge three Cultural Relic Fragments as an action.
  2. If an eliminated player had any Cultural Relic Fragments, they are discarded to the cultural planet exploration discard pile.

data.name: CutSupplyLines
CyberneticResearchFacility
DacxiveAnimators
DarkEnergyTap
data.value:
1. A ship may be moved into the system containing the frontier token during the same action that it is explored.
  2. Exploring the frontier token happens at the end of the tactical action. Notably, this is after the Space Cannon Offense and/or Space Combat steps.
  3. A player cannot use Dark Energy Tap to retreat into a system that contains another player’s units, including ground forces and structures on planets.

data.name: DarkenTheSkies
data.value: 1. Darken the Skies may be scored by winning a combat in an eliminated player’s home system.

data.name: DarkVisions
DeadlyPlot
data.value:
1. Any prediction made for a rider or similar ability is incorrect, and will not resolve.
  2. A player cannot make the prediction that Deadly Plot will be played when they predict the outcome of an agenda.
  3. Deadly Plot is played after any effects that allow a player to cast additional votes, and after any effects that change the outcome of an agenda.
  4. Deadly Plot is played before revealing the hidden agenda for the Covert Legislation agenda, and before the Drive the Debate objective may be scored.
  5. If a player predicts multiple outcomes, they may play Deadly Plot regardless of which outcome would be resolved.
    1. If the Xxcha player uses their commander, Elder Qanoj, to vote for one outcome, when they have predicted another, they may play Deadly Plot regardless of which outcome would be resolved.

data.name: DeadWorld
data.value: 1. If the relic deck is empty, Dead World will be discarded with no effect.

data.name: DecoyOperation
data.value: 1. If a mech is damaged when it is removed, it will remain damaged when it is placed.

data.name: DefySpaceAndTime
data.value:
1. The number of units in the system is irrelevant, if there is at least one.
  2. A ship, ground force, or structure will all qualify for Defy Space and Time.
    1. If one player has a ground force or structure on Mallice, and another player has a ship in the wormhole nexus, both players may score Defy Space and Time, if it is elected by the Classified Document Leaks agenda.

data.name: DemilitarizedZone
data.value: 1. After the active player has returned ground forces on the planet to the space area, if they do not have enough capacity in the space area for the returned ground forces, including zero capacity, they will have to remove fighters and/or ground forces to meet capacity limits.

data.name: DemonstrateYourPower
data.value:
1. A player need not win the combat to score Demonstrate Your Power; they are able to score it if their opponent plays the Skilled Retreat action card.
  2. A player involved in a combat due to the Mahact player’s Benediction hero ability may score Demonstrate Your Power after that combat.
  3. Units that are temporarily ships for the duration of a space combat, such as those made so by the Nekro player’s flagship, The Alastor, or the Naaz–Rokha player’s Z–Grav Eidolon mechs, may count towards scoring Demonstrate Your Power.
  4. The Mentak player may use the Sleeper Cell ability of their hero, during the last round of combat to place ships before scoring Demonstrate Your Power. However, fleet pool limits are also checked before scoring.
    1. The Mentak player cannot use the ability of their Salvage Operations technology until after the window in which to score Demonstrate Your Power.

data.name: DerelictVessel
data.value: 1. A player with three scored secret objectives may draw a fourth. However, they must immediately shuffle it into the secret objective deck.

data.name: DesertedTradeStation
DestroyHereticalWorks
data.value:
1. A player will not gain a relic when scoring Destroy Heretical Works.
  2. The relic fragments may be the same or different types.

data.name: DestroyTheirGreatestShip
data.value:
1. If a player destroys their own flagship or war sun during combat, such as via the effect of The Crown of Thalnos relic, their opponent cannot score Destroy their Greatest Ship.
  2. Destroy their Greatest Ship is scored as soon as the war sun or flagship is destroyed; it does not require waiting until the end of the combat.
    1. A player does not have to win a combat to score Destroy their Greatest Ship.
  3. A player may score Destroy their Greatest Ship outside of a combat.

data.name: DevelopWeaponry
data.value:
1. A Valefar Assimilator technology will count if it is currently copying another player’s faction unit upgrade technology.
  2. If the Nekro player owns both a generic unit upgrade technology and a faction unit upgrade technology of the same type, only the faction unit upgrade technology will count for Develop Weaponry.

data.name: DictatePolicy
data.value:
1. Dictate Policy is scored after the third law resolves. As such, the Deadly Plot action card will prevent any player from scoring Dictate Policy.
  2. Dictate Policy is scored before any rider action cards are resolved.
  3. If there are three laws in play at the start of the agenda phase, a player may score Dictate Policy immediately.
  4. If the Political Data Nexus Xxcha hero ability puts a third law in play during the action phase, Dictate Policy cannot be scored until the agenda phase.

data.name: DiplomacyRider
data.value:
1. The Mecatol Rex system may be chosen.
  2. After playing a Diplomacy Rider, a player may use additional abilities, including playing other rider cards.
    1. Any other riders may be played to predict the same or a different outcome.
  3. The effect of a successful Diplomacy Rider will be resolved after the effect of the agenda.
  4. A player who cannot vote may still play a Diplomacy Rider.

data.name: DiplomaticPressure
data.value:
1. The target player chooses which promissory note they give.
  2. A player cannot play a second Diplomatic Pressure targeting the same player during the same agenda.
    1. A player may play a second Diplomatic Pressure targeting a different player during the same agenda.
    2. Another player may play a second Diplomatic Pressure targeting the same player during the same agenda.
    3. A player may play a second Diplomatic Pressure targeting the same player during a later agenda.

data.name: DirectHit
data.value:
1. If multiple ships use their Sustain Damage ability, a Direct Hit may be played for each.
  2. A Direct Hit may be used whenever hits produced by a player’s units or abilities are cancelled by a unit using its Sustain Damage ability.
  3. When a player uses the Sustain Damage ability of one of their units, they do not have to decide if another of their units in the same combat will use its Sustain Damage ability until after their opponent has used or declined to use a Direct Hit.
  4. When Direct Hit is used outside of combat, if used on a ship with capacity, then fighters and/or ground forces must immediately be removed from the space area to meet the capacity limit.
    1. For example, say a player has a dreadnought, a destroyer and a fighter in a system with no other units during the Space Cannon Defense step. During the Roll Dice step, two hits are produced against that player. They cancel one with the dreadnought’s Sustain Damage ability, but a Direct Hit is played to destroy it. The fighter in that system is immediately removed. The player must then assign the other produced hit to their destroyer.
  5. A mech cannot be destroyed by Direct Hit, unless a game effect causes the mech to be considered a ship.

data.name: Disable
data.value:
1. If the Ul player is targeted, their Hel–Titans will still participate in the ground combat during the current invasion.
  2. Disable has no effect on the Magen Defense Grid Ω technology.

data.name: DiscoverLostOutposts
data.value: 1. The number of attachments a planet has is irrelevant, if it has at least one.

data.name: DistinguishedAdmiral
DistinguishedCouncilor
data.value:
1. A player must have cast votes for an outcome to play Distinguished Councilor, and the additional votes must be cast for the same outcome.
  2. A player may only play Distinguished Councilor after their normal vote, not after they cast additional votes at another point.
  3. The speaker may play Distinguished Councilor after another player plays Bribery.
  4. Distinguished Councilor is played before any effects that change the outcome of an agenda.

data.name: DiversifyResearch
DivertFunding
data.value:
1. A player must have at least one non–unit upgrade, non–faction technology to play and resolve Divert Funding.
  2. A player must still meet the prerequisites for the technology they research.
    1. The returned technology does not count towards meeting the prerequisites.
  3. The researched technology may be a unit upgrade technology, and it may be a faction technology.
  4. The researched technology cannot be the returned technology.
  5. Other players must decide whether to play Sabotage before the player playing Divert Funding announces which technology they are researching.
  6. If a player later gains the technology they returned, they gain it readied.

data.name: DominusOrb
DriveTheDebate
data.value:
1. Any “For”/“Against” agenda cannot count for Drive the Debate, even if the outcome affects only a single player.
  2. Drive the Debate is scored immediately before the agenda resolves. The Confounding Legal Text and Confusing Legal Text action cards will allow only the newly elected player to score Drive the Debate, and the Deadly Plot action card will prevent any player from scoring Drive the Debate.
  3. Scoring Drive the Debate immediately before the Colonial Redistribution agenda is resolved may change which player(s) can be chosen to place the infantry on the elected planet.
  4. If a player draws Drive the Debate while resolving the Archived Secret or Search Warrant agendas, they cannot score it immediately.

data.name: DuraniumArmor
data.value:
1. A player must mandatorily repair a unit with Duranium Armor during each round of combat, if possible.
  2. Duranium Armor is used even if a player’s opponent produced no hits during a round of combat.
  3. If a player starts a combat with a damaged unit, they use Duranium Armor in the first round of combat.
    1. A player may use Duranium Armor to repair a unit damaged by Space Cannon or Bombardment hits that occurred immediately before the combat.
  4. If a unit is damaged during combat without using its Sustain Damage ability, it may be repaired by Duranium Armor during the same combat round.
  5. Only units participating in the combat may be chosen to be repaired.

data.name: DynamisCore
data.value: 1. If a player uses the purge ability of Dynamis Core, they will need to return commodities if they now exceed their original commodity value.

data.name: DysonSphere
EconomicEquality
data.value: 1. If the “For” outcome of Economic Equality is resolved, the Mentak player may resolve their Pillage faction ability against each of their neighbors.

data.name: EconomicInitiative
data.value: 1. A player with zero cultural planets may play Economic Initiative.

data.name: EmergencyRepairs
data.value: 1. A player may play Emergency Repairs at the start of the first round of combat to repair ships damaged in a previous combat, or during the Space Cannon Offense step of the current action.

data.name: EnforcedTravelBan
data.value:
1. The effect of the Enforced Travel Ban law does not affect the Creuss player.
  2. Enforced Travel Ban only prevents movement using the normal adjacency provided by wormholes. Other effects that create adjacency, such as the Wormhole Reconstruction agenda or the Lost Star Chart action card, may be used to allow movement between systems containing wormholes.
  3. When the Enforced Travel Ban law is in play, units cannot move through wormholes, even by effects that move ships outside of the Movement step of a tactical action, such as while retreating.
  4. When the Enforced Travel Ban law is in play, hits may still be produced against ships in the active system by units with the Deep Space Cannon ability in systems that are adjacent via a wormhole during the Space Cannon Offense step of a tactical action.
  5. Players may still be neighbors via systems that are adjacent via wormholes.
  6. The “Against” effect of Enforced Travel Ban will affect PDS in or adjacent to systems containing an alpha, beta, delta or gamma wormhole.

data.name: EngineerAMarvel
EnigmaticDevice
data.value: 1. A player cannot play Enigmatic Device as a component action if they have less than six resources available.

data.name: EntropicField
ErectAMonument
data.value:
1. The resources must be spent during the status phase. Any resources that were spent during the action phase will have no effect.
  2. Trade goods may be spent as resources when scoring Erect a Monument.

data.name: ESixGoNetwork
EstablishAPerimeter
EstablishHegemony
data.value: 1. With the right attachments, the requirements of Establish Hegemony may be met with a single planet.

data.name: ExecutiveSanctions
data.value: 1. The effect of the Executive Sanctions law does not affect the Yssaril player.

data.name: ExpandBorders
data.value: 1. The planets cannot be in any player’s home system, including those of eliminated players.

data.name: Expedition
ExperimentalBattlestation
data.value:
1. The selected space dock will use the Space Cannon ability during the Space Cannon Offense step of the current tactical action.
  2. Hits may only be assigned to the active player’s ships.
  3. Experimental Battlestation cannot be played if no ships are moved into the active system, even if the active player already has ships in that system.
    1. If ships are moved into the active system, ships that were already in that system may be assigned any hits produced.
    2. If a ship is moved out of the active system and then back in, Experimental Battlestation may be played.
    3. If all moving ships are lost to a gravity rift, and none arrive in the active system, Experimental Battlestation cannot be played.
  4. Experimental Battlestation cannot be played if ships are moved outside of the Move Ships step, such as during a retreat, or while resolving the Mahact player’s Benediction hero ability.
  5. The hits produced by the Experimental Battlestation space cannon rolls may be cancelled with Maneuvering Jets.

data.name: ExplorationProbe
data.value: 1. A player must have an exploration token in or adjacent to a system containing one or more of their ships to play and resolve Exploration Probe.

data.name: ExploreDeepSpace
data.value:
1. The number of units in the system is irrelevant, if there is at least one.
  2. A system that contains a planet destroyed by the Stellar Converter relic, and no other planets, is considered to contain no planets.

data.name: EyeOfVogul
FighterConscription
data.value:
1. Only one fighter will be placed in a system containing both a space dock and a ship with capacity.
  2. A player may place a fighter in a system that is at its capacity limit. If they do so, they must then remove a fighter or ground force from the space area of that system.

data.name: FighterPrototype
FightWithPrecision
data.value:
1. Scoring Fight with Precision will count as that player’s single secret objective scoring for that combat.
  2. Fight with Precision is scored immediately in the Anti–Fighter Barrage step of combat.
    1. A player does not have to win a combat to score Fight with Precision.
  3. If a player’s last fighter in a system is destroyed, but an ability allows that player to then place fighters into that system, Fight with Precision may still be scored.

data.name: FightWithPrecisionOmega
data.value:
1. Scoring Fight with Precision Ω will count as that player’s single secret objective scoring for that combat.
  2. Fight with Precision is scored immediately in the Anti–Fighter Barrage step of combat.
    1. A player does not have to win a combat to score Fight with Precision.
  3. If a player’s last fighter in a system is destroyed, but an ability allows that player to then place fighters into that system, Fight with Precision Ω may still be scored.
  4. Any effect that destroys fighters during the Anti–Fighter Barrage step may be used to score Fight with Precision Ω, not just hits produced by an anti–fighter barrage roll.
    1. For example, say a player plays the Courageous to the End action card when one of their fighters are destroyed during the Anti–Fighter Barrage step. If the dice roll causes their opponent to destroy their ships, and they choose their last fighter, that would allow the player to score Fight with Precision Ω.

data.name: FireTeam
data.value: 1. Any modifiers on the original combat roll will apply to the reroll.

data.name: FlankSpeed
data.value:
1. A second Flank Speed cannot be played to give +2 to the move value of each ship.
  2. Cancelling Flank Speed will not cancel the system activation.

data.name: FleetLogistics
data.value:
1. Effects that trigger at the start or end of a player’s turn will not trigger between each of those player’s actions.
  2. A player may use the ability of Fleet Logistics the same turn they gain it.

data.name: FleetRegulations
data.value:
1. The effect of the Fleet Regulations law does not prevent the Letnev player from using their Armada faction ability. They may have up to six non–fighter ships in a system if they have four command tokens in their fleet pool.
  2. The Mahact player may only have up to four command tokens in their fleet pool when the Fleet Regulations law is in play, regardless of which faction the command tokens belong to.

data.name: FocusedResearch
data.value:
1. A player cannot play Focused Research if they have less than four trade goods.
  2. A player must still meet the prerequisites for the technology they research.
  3. Other players must decide whether to play Sabotage before the player playing Focused Research announces which technology they are researching.

data.name: FoldedSpace
ForgeAnAlliance
FormASpyNetwork
data.value: 1. The action cards must be discarded during the status phase. Any action cards that were discarded during the action phase will have no effect.

data.name: FormGalacticBrainTrust
ForwardSupplyBase
FosterCohesion
data.value:
1. The Hacan player’s Guild Ships faction ability and Trade Convoys promissory note does not make a player neighbors with all other players.
  2. If a player has units or controls a planet in a system containing an alpha wormhole, and the Creuss player has units or controls a planet in a system containing a beta wormhole, or vice versa, those two players are neighbors.

data.name: FotgottenThrone
FoundAGoldenAge
data.value:
1. The resources must be spent during the status phase. Any resources that were spent during the action phase will have no effect.
  2. Trade goods may be spent as resources when scoring Found a Golden Age.

data.name: FoundResearchOutposts
Freelancers
data.value:
1. A planet may be exhausted to spend its influence or resources, but not both.
  2. If a player is to gain multiple planets in a system, they choose the order in which they gain them, and explore each planet as they gain it before gaining the next. As such, a player cannot place ground forces produced by Freelancers on a planet in the active system that they are yet to gain and explore.
  3. If a player wishes to place a unit, but there are none of that type left in their reinforcements, they may remove a unit of that type from any system that does not contain one of their command tokens and place that instead. This unit will be placed undamaged.

data.name: FrontlineDeployment
data.value:
1. A player must control at least one planet to play and resolve Frontline Deployment.
  2. All three infantry must be placed on a single planet.

data.name: FuelTheWarMachine
FunctioningBase
data.value: 1. A player cannot have more commodities than their commodity value.

data.name: GalacticCrisisPact
data.value:
1. Players resolve the secondary ability of the elected strategy card in speaker order.
  2. The secondary ability is resolved immediately, during the agenda phase.
  3. Players must pay the influence or resource costs to resolve the abilities of the Leadership, Warfare or Technology strategy cards if they are elected. Any planets used to pay these costs will ready at the end of the agenda phase.
  4. If the Technology strategy card is elected, a player may exhaust a planet with a technology specialty to ignore a prerequisite on a technology as normal. This planet will ready at the end of the agenda phase.
    1. A player may exhaust the AI Development Algorithm technology to ignore a prerequisite on a unit upgrade technology as normal. AI Development Algorithm will not ready at the end of the agenda phase.
  5. If a player has a strategy card in their play area due to the effect of the Political Stability action card, that strategy card is eligible to be elected.

data.name: GalvanizeThePeople
data.value:
1. The command tokens must be spent during the status phase. Any command tokens that were spent during the action phase will have no effect.
  2. Any effect that triggers when a command token is spent will be triggered six times. For example, if the Muaat player has unlocked their commander, Magmus, they will gain six trade goods, one at a time, when scoring Galvanize the People.

data.name: GammaRelay
GammaWormhole
GatherAMightyFleet
GhostShip
data.value:
1. A player may place the destroyer in the Creuss gate (tile 17), the wormhole nexus, or any system with a printed wormhole or wormhole token.
    1. Placing the destroyer in the inactive wormhole nexus will cause it to flip to its active side.
  2. The destroyer cannot be placed in the home system of an eliminated player.
  3. There must be an eligible system to place the destroyer in for a player to play and resolve Ghost Ship.
  4. If a player wishes to place a destroyer, but there are none left in their reinforcements, they may remove a destroyer from any system that does not contain one of their command tokens and place that instead.

data.name: GhostSquad
data.value:
1. Ghost Squad is played after the active player has assigned which planet each of their ground forces are being committed to. They cannot modify this after Ghost Squad has been played.
  2. Ghost Squad may be played whenever ground forces are committed, such as from the Yin player’s Quantum Dissemination Ω hero ability.
    1. Ghost Squad cannot be played in response to abilities that place ground forces on a planet without committing them, such as the Colonial Redistribution agenda.
  3. The Ul player cannot use Ghost Squad to move a Hel–Titan.
  4. A player may move zero ground forces with Ghost Squad.

data.name: GravitonLaserSystem
data.value: 1. If multiple players are resolving the Space Cannon ability of their units against the active player, the active player must resolve capacity limits after assigning one player’s hits and before the next player makes their space cannon roll.

data.name: GravityDrive
HackElection
data.value:
1. The speaker will still vote last.
  2. The Argent player will still vote before all other players.

data.name: HarnessEnergy
data.value: 1. If a player has their maximum number of commodities, they may still play Harness Energy. If they do, they will still trigger any “when [this] player replenishes commodities” effects, most notably the Trade Agreement promissory note.

data.name: HazardousRelicFragment
data.value:
1. If the relic deck is empty, a player may still purge three Hazardous Relic Fragments as an action.
  2. If an eliminated player had any Hazardous Relic Fragments, they are discarded to the hazardous planet exploration discard pile.

data.name: HiddenLab
HoardRawMaterials
data.value: 1. With the right attachments, the requirements of Hoard Raw Materials may be met with a single planet.

data.name: HoldVastReserves
data.value:
1. The influence, resources and trade goods must be spent during the status phase. Any that were spent during the action phase will have no effect.
  2. A planet may be exhausted to spend either its resource or influence value, but not both.
  3. Trade goods may be spent as influence or resources when scoring Hold Vast Reserves.

data.name: HolyPlanetOfIxth
data.value: 1. If the Holy Planet of Ixth law is discarded, no player loses a victory point.

data.name: HomelandDefenseAct
data.value: 1. If the Homeland Defense Act law is discarded, players might have to remove PDS so that they have no more than two on each planet.

data.name: HyperMetabolism
ImperialArbiter
data.value:
1. If either strategy card had trade goods on it at the start of the strategy phase, those trade goods remain with the player that originally chose the strategy card.
  2. In a three– or four–player game, the owner of Imperial Arbiter chooses which strategy cards are swapped.

data.name: ImperialRider
data.value:
1. After playing an Imperial Rider, a player may use additional abilities, including playing other rider cards.
    1. Any other riders may be played to predict the same or a different outcome.
  2. The effect of a successful Imperial Rider will be resolved after the effect of the agenda.
  3. A player who cannot vote may still play an Imperial Rider.

data.name: Impersonation
data.value:
1. A player cannot play Impersonation if they have less than three influence available.
  2. A player with three secret objectives may draw a fourth, and then shuffle one of their unscored secret objectives into the secret objective deck.
    1. If a player has scored three secret objectives, they may use Impersonation to draw a secret objective, then immediately shuffle it into the secret objective deck.

data.name: ImproveInfrastructure
data.value:
1. The number of structures on the planet is irrelevant, if there is at least one.
  2. The structures may be on planets in another player’s home system.
  3. The Saar player’s Floating Factories cannot be used to score Improve Infrastructure.

data.name: IncentiveProgram
IndustrialInitiative
data.value: 1. A player with zero industrial planets may play Industrial Initiative.

data.name: IndustrialRelicFragment
data.value:
1. If the relic deck is empty, a player may still purge three Industrial Relic Fragments as an action.
  2. If an eliminated player had any Industrial Relic Fragments, they are discarded to the industrial planet exploration discard pile.

data.name: Infiltrate
data.value:
1. If the L1Z1X player plays Infiltrate before they resolve their Assimilate ability, or vice versa, they will replace zero PDS and space docks with zero PDS and space docks when they resolve the latter ability.
  2. If a player wishes to place a structure, but there are none of that type left in their reinforcements, they may remove a structure of that type from any system that does not contain one of their command tokens and place that instead. That player may make the choice for each structure.
    1. The Ul player will place each of their Hel Titan PDS undamaged.

data.name: InsiderInformation
Insubordination
data.value: 1. Insubordination cannot target a player with zero command tokens in their tactic pool.

data.name: IntegratedEconomy
data.value:
1. The produced units must be paid for.
  2. There is no limit on the number of units produced, so long as the combined cost does not exceed the planet’s resource value.
  3. Two fighters or two infantry have a combined cost of one resource.
  4. A player may produce ships with Integrated Economy, unless another player has ships in the space area of that planet’s system.

data.name: Intercept
data.value:
1. During the next round of combat, the targeted player may declare another retreat.
  2. Intercept cannot be played to prevent Skilled Retreat or the Naalu player’s Foresight faction ability.

data.name: InTheSilenceOfSpace
data.value: 1. Only the ships in the chosen system may move through systems that contain other players’ ships. Ships in other systems may still move to the active system if they are able to do so without moving through systems that contain other players’ ships.

data.name: IntimidateCouncil
data.value:
1. Any ships in the Mecatol Rex system are irrelevant.
  2. Any ground forces or structures are irrelevant.

data.name: IonStorm
data.value:
1. The active player chooses which side of the Ion Storm token is initially face up.
  2. All ship movement is simultaneous. If the Ion Storm token system is the active system, and the token is currently on the alpha side, a player cannot move a ship from a system with an alpha wormhole, flip the token, then move a ship from a system with the beta wormhole (then flip the token again).
    1. The Creuss player may do this by moving their Hil Colish flagship before or after their other ships.
  3. If the Ion Storm token is in a system containing a wormhole of the same type, a player chooses which wormhole they use when moving through a wormhole of that type. The Ion Storm token only flips if it was the chosen wormhole.
    1. As a system is never adjacent to itself, a ship cannot move out through one wormhole and in through the other while remaining in the system. The ship must pass through another system with a wormhole to use both wormholes.
  4. If ships are moved through the Ion Storm token wormhole outside of the Move Ship or Retreat substeps of a tactical action, such as by the effect of the Skilled Retreat action card, the Ion Storm token is not flipped.

data.name: IxthianArtifact
data.value:
1. A player must still meet the prerequisites for the technology they research.
    1. A player may use the first technology they research to meet the prerequisites of the second technology they research.
    2. A player may exhaust a planet with a technology specialty to ignore a prerequisite on a technology as normal. This planet will ready at the end of the agenda phase.
    3. A player may exhaust the AI Development Algorithm technology to ignore a prerequisite on a unit upgrade technology as normal. AI Development Algorithm will not ready at the end of the agenda phase.
  2. A player with three or fewer units in a system adjacent to the Mecatol Rex system destroys all of their units in that system. Otherwise, a player chooses which three units are destroyed.
  3. All units are destroyed simultaneously.
  4. To cast votes against or to play a rider on Ixthian Artifact is to commit heresy.

data.name: JRXS455OLostTitanPrototypeAgent
data.value:
1. JR-XS455-O is an agent. All rules that apply to agents (and leaders) apply to JR-XS455-O.
    1. JR-XS455-O may be refreshed by the Nomad player's Temporal Command Suite technology.
    2. The ability of JR-XS455-O may be duplicated by the Yssaril player’s agent, Ssruu, if the Yssaril player themselves do not own JR-XS455-O.

data.name: JudicialAbolishment
data.value:
1. If Judicial Abolishment is revealed when only one law is in play, players may only vote for that law or abstain. If no votes are cast, the speaker must decide for that law to be elected.
    1. Players may still play riders if only one law is in play.

data.name: KeleresShip
LazaxSurvivors
LeadershipRider
data.value:
1. After playing a Leadership Rider, a player may use additional abilities, including playing other rider cards.
    1. Any other riders may be played to predict the same or a different outcome.
  2. The effect of a successful Leadership Rider will be resolved after the effect of the agenda.
  3. A player who cannot vote may still play a Leadership Rider.

data.name: LeadFromTheFront
data.value:
1. The command tokens must be spent during the status phase. Any command tokens that were spent during the action phase will have no effect.
  2. Any effect that triggers when a command token is spent will be triggered three times. For example, if the Muaat player has unlocked their commander, Magmus, they will gain three trade goods, one at a time when scoring Lead From the Front.

data.name: LearnTheSecretsOfTheCosmos
data.value:
1. The three systems may be mutually adjacent to one system, or separate systems.
  2. Having ships in an anomaly is irrelevant, unless that system is also adjacent to another anomaly.
  3. Any ground forces or structures are irrelevant.
  4. Any system containing a Vuil’raith player’s Dimensional Tear is a gravity rift, and thus, an anomaly.

data.name: LightWaveDeflector
LocalFabricators
data.value:
1. A player cannot have more commodities than their commodity value.
  2. If a player wishes to place a mech, but there are none left in their reinforcements, they may remove a mech from any system that does not contain one of their command tokens and place that instead. The mech will be placed undamaged.

data.name: LostCrew
LostStarChart
data.value:
1. If the Enforced Travel Ban law is in play, Lost Star Chart will allow a player to move through wormholes during this action.
    1. A player may move from a system containing an alpha wormhole to a system containing an alpha wormhole, and similarly for beta wormholes.
  2. If the active system contains a beta wormhole, a player that has a unit with the Deep Space Cannon ability in an alpha wormhole may produce hits against ships in the active system during the Space Cannon Offense step of the tactical action, and vice versa.
  3. A player may retreat from a system containing an alpha wormhole into a system containing a beta wormhole, and vice versa, during this action.
  4. If a player has units or controls planets in a system with an alpha wormhole, and another player has units or controls planets in a system with a beta wormhole, then those two players are neighbors during this action.
    1. The Mentak player may use their Pillage ability against a player in this manner.
  5. A player moving a ship between two systems, both with alpha wormholes or both with beta wormholes, does not have to move through the wormhole, as the systems are adjacent. In particular, if one of those systems has the Ion Storm token, that player chooses if the Ion Storm token will flip.

data.name: LuckyShot
data.value:
1. A player cannot use Lucky Shot against their own units.
  2. Effects that cancel hits, such as Sustain Damage, cannot be used to prevent ships from being destroyed.

data.name: MagenDefenseGrid
data.value: 1. Magen Defense Grid cannot be used if all of a player’s units in combat that had the Planetary Shield ability have lost it.

data.name: MagenDefenseGridOmega
data.value:
1. The player with Magen Defense Grid Ω chooses which ground force the hit is assigned to.
  2. The chosen ground force may cancel the hit by using its Sustain Damage ability, if present. A different ground force with the Sustain Damage ability cannot do so.
  3. If the last of a player’s ground forces in a ground combat are destroyed by the effect of Magen Defense Grid Ω, that player loses the combat immediately. They will be unable to use any “start of combat” abilities.

data.name: MajorEntropicField
MakeAnExampleOfTheirWorld
data.value:
1. If the last ground force is destroyed using the X–89 Bacterial Weapon Ω technology, Make an Example of Their World cannot be scored.
  2. Scoring Make an Example of Their World will not prevent that player from scoring a secret objective in any ground combats during this tactical action.
  3. If a player’s last ground force on a planet is destroyed, but an ability allows that player to then place ground forces onto that planet, Make an Example of Their World may still be scored.
  4. The L1Z1X player may score Make an Example of Their World by using their Harrow faction ability. If they do they cannot score another objective during that ground combat.

data.name: MakeAnExampleOfTheirWorldOmega
data.value:
1. If the last ground force is destroyed using the X–89 Bacterial Weapon Ω technology, Make an Example of Their World Ω may be scored.
  2. Scoring Make an Example of Their World Ω will not prevent that player from scoring a secret objective in any ground combats during this tactical action.
  3. If a player’s last ground force on a planet is destroyed, but an ability allows that player to then place ground forces onto that planet, Make an Example of Their World Ω may still be scored.
  4. The L1Z1X player cannot score Make an Example of Their World Ω by using their Harrow faction ability.

data.name: MakeHistory
data.value:
1. The number of units in the system is irrelevant, if there is at least one.
  2. A ship, ground force, or structure will all qualify for Make History.
    1. If one player has a ground force or structure on a planet in a qualifying system, and another player has a ship in the same system, both players may count the system towards the requirements of Make History.
    2. A player may have ships in the system containing a legendary planet or Mecatol Rex without controlling the planet for that system to count towards the requirements of Make History.
  3. If Mirage is placed in an anomaly, or the Nano–Forge relic is attached to a planet in an anomaly, that system will only count as one system towards the requirements of Make History.
  4. Any system containing a Vuil’raith player’s Dimensional Tear is a gravity rift, and thus, an anomaly.
    1. If a Vuil’raith player’s Dimensional Tear is in a system containing another anomaly, a legendary planet, or Mecatol Rex, that system will only count as one system towards the requirements of Make History.

data.name: ManeuveringJets
data.value:
1. Maneuvering Jets cannot be used to cancel hits during combat.
  2. Maneuvering Jets may cancel hits produced during either the Space Cannon Offense or the Space Cannon Defense step.
  3. A player cannot play a second Maneuvering Jets to cancel a second hit produced by the same Space Cannon roll.
    1. During the Space Cannon Offense step, each player makes their Space Cannon roll independent of each other player, in clockwise order. As such, a player may use one Maneuvering Jets after each other player makes a space cannon roll.
    2. During the Space Cannon Defense step, the units on each planet make their Space Cannon roll independent of the units on each other planet. The active player chooses the order. As such, a player may use one Maneuvering Jets for each planet they are committing ground forces to.
  4. Maneuvering Jets may cancel hits produced due to the Experimental Battlestation action card.

data.name: ManipulateGalacticLaw
data.value:
1. The influence must be spent during the status phase. Any influence that was spent during the action phase will have no effect.
  2. Trade goods may be spent as influence when scoring Manipulate Galactic Law.

data.name: ManipulateInvestments
data.value:
1. If a player still has a strategy card because of Political Stability, trade goods may be placed on that strategy card. However, those trade goods will remain on that strategy card until it is chosen from the common area.
    1. If a player takes the strategy card with trade goods on it from the player who played Political Stability, using the ability of the Imperial Arbiter law or similar, they will not gain the trade goods, which will remain on the strategy card.

data.name: MasterPlan
data.value: 1. Effects that trigger at the start or end of a player’s turn will not trigger between each of those player’s actions.

data.name: MasterTheLawsOfPhysics
MasterTheSciences
MawOfWorlds
data.value: 1. The player does not have to meet the prerequisites of the technologies they acquire using Maw of Worlds.

data.name: MechanizeTheMilitary
data.value: 1. Given that each player only has four mechs, to score Mechanize the Military, a player will have to have all of them on the game board, and on separate planets.

data.name: MercenaryOutfit
MerchantStation
MineRareMinerals
MiningInitiative
data.value:
1. A player must control at least one planet to play and resolve Mining Initiative.
  2. Mining Initiative does not exhaust the chosen planet.

data.name: MiningWorld
MinisterOfAntiquities
MinisterOfCommerce
data.value:
1. Minister of Commerce triggers when its owner has their commodities replenished by any game effect.
    1. Gaining a fixed number of commodities does not trigger Minister of Commerce, even if doing so would result in its owner having commodities equal to their commodity value.
  2. All trade goods are gained together.

data.name: MinisterOfExploration
data.value: 1. If the owner of Minister of Exploration gains control of multiple planets during one invasion, the trade goods are gained one at a time.

data.name: MinisterOfIndustry
data.value:
1. All units in that system may use their Production ability, not just the placed space dock.
  2. The produced units must be paid for.
  3. A space dock cannot be placed on a planet already containing a space dock.
  4. An ability that puts a space dock on the game board by “replacing”, rather than “placing”, such as the Infiltrate action card, will trigger Minister of Industry.

data.name: MinisterOfPeace
data.value:
1. Once a player resolves the ability of Minister of Peace, the active player cannot use any “after you activate a system” abilities.
    1. Other players, including the Minister of Peace player, cannot use any “after another player activates a system that…” abilities.
  2. The active player may still use any “at the end of your turn” abilities when their turn is ended by Minister of Peace.
  3. The player that owns Minister of Peace does not have to have any of their units in the active system to resolve Minister of Peace, so long as any non–active player owns at least one unit in the active system.

data.name: MinisterOfPolicy
data.value:
1. The owner of Minister of Policy will draw action cards during the Draw Action Cards step of the status phase, and again at the end of the status phase.
    1. If the Yssaril player owns Minister of Policy, they will use their Scheming ability for both the Draw Action Cards step and for Minister of Policy. However, they do not draw all the cards together; they must fully resolve Scheming by discarding an action card for the Draw Action Cards step before drawing any action cards for Minister of Policy.
  2. Neural Motivator does not apply when the owner of Minister of Policy draws action cards from its effect.

data.name: MinisterOfSciences
MinisterOfWar
data.value: 1. Effects that trigger at the start or end of a player’s turn will not trigger between each of those player’s action.

data.name: MinorEntropicField
Mirage
MiscountDisclosed
data.value:
1. If Miscount Disclosed is revealed when only one law is in play, players may only vote for that law or abstain. If no votes are cast, the speaker must decide for that law to be elected.
    1. Players may still play riders if only one law is in play.
  2. The elected law remains in play, and remains elected to the same object if applicable, while it is being voted on.
    1. If Articles of War is elected by Miscount Disclosed, the Hacan player’s transactions during the revote cannot involve any planets containing their Pride of Kenara mechs, and the Empyrean player cannot cancel action cards played during the revote with their Watcher mechs.
    2. If Classified Document Leaks is elected by Miscount Disclosed, the objective that was originally elected will remain a public objective during the vote. It therefore cannot be re–elected.
    3. If Committee Formation is elected by Miscount Disclosed, the owner may use its ability. The elected player will receive Committee Formation from the discard pile.
    4. If Homeland Defense Act is elected by Miscount Disclosed, and the “For” effect is resolved again, players will not have to remove any PDS from the board.
    5. If Political Censure is elected by Miscount Disclosed, the current owner cannot play action cards, including Confounding Legal Text, if another player is elected. If another player is elected, that player may play the Confusing Legal Text action card.
    6. If Wormhole Reconstruction is elected by Miscount Disclosed, the Mentak player will remain neighbors with players through wormholes, allowing them to use their Pillage faction ability on those players. The Empyrean player’s Watcher mechs will remain adjacent to other players’ units through wormholes, allowing them to cancel action cards played with the mech’s ability.
    7. If Representative Government is elected by Miscount Disclosed, each player will cast only one vote during the revote.
    8. If the elected law is attached to a planet, and is increasing its influence value, the player that controls that planet may still cast votes using the increased influence.
  3. Once the law is elected, any riders on Miscount Disclosed will resolve. Following that, the elected law is then treated as being revealed.
    1. If Classified Document Leaks is elected by Miscount Disclosed, and there are no other secret objectives eligable to be elected by the Miscount Disclosed revote, Classified Document Leaks will be discarded and replaced.
    2. When the elected law is treated as revealed, the Veto action card, the Xxcha Quash faction ability, or the Xxcha Political Favor promissory note may be played. If so, the law will be discarded and replaced.
    3. The Political Secret promissory note may also be played when the elected law is treated as revealed.
    4. After the elected law is treated as revealed, riders may be played to predict the outcome of the elected law.
  4. After all players have voted for Miscount Disclosed, the Deadly Plot action card may be played. If so, the elected law is not voted on and remains in play.
  5. After all players have voted for the elected law, the Deadly Plot action card may be played. If so, the elected law is discarded.
  6. Players who resolved a transaction while voting on and resolving Miscount Disclosed may resolve an additional transaction voting on and resolving the elected law.
  7. If Holy Planet of Ixth, Shard of the Throne or The Crown of Emphidia is elected by Miscount Disclosed, the owner will not lose a victory point.

data.name: MonopolizeProduction
MoraleBoost
data.value:
1. The +1 will apply to any rerolls during the combat round.
  2. A second Morale Boost cannot be played during a combat round to give +2 to the combat rolls of a player’s units.
  3. Morale Boost has no effect on anti–fighter barrage rolls.

data.name: Mutiny
data.value: 1. If the “For” outcome of Mutiny is resolved, players gain victory points in speaker order.

data.name: NanoForge
data.value: 1. The attached planet will not have a corresponding legendary planet ability card. However, it will be legendary for effects such as scoring the Make History and similar objectives, transferring the Shard of the Throne relic, and the Winnu player's commander, Rickar Rickani. The attached planet will also no longer be non–legendary for effects such as the Stellar Converter relic.

data.name: NavSuite
data.value:
1. Wormholes are not anomalies.
  2. An anomaly will retain its regular effect if a player retreats.
  3. A player may move ships through or into an asteroid field without the Antimass Deflectors technology. After moving into, those ships may remain there and move out during a later action without harm.
  4. A player may move ships through or out of a gravity rift without rolling for removal. Those ships will not get +1 to their move value.
  5. A player may move ships through a nebula. Ships moving out of a nebula retain their normal move value.
  6. A player may move ships through or into a supernova. After moving into, those ships may remain there and move out during a later action without harm.
  7. Other players cannot ignore the effect of anomalies during this tactical action.
    1. The Naalu player will still be affected by anomalies if they use their Foresight faction ability.

data.name: NegotiateTradeRoutes
data.value: 1. The trade goods must be spent during the status phase. Any trade goods that were spent during the action phase will have no effect.

data.name: NeuralMotivator
data.value:
1. Neural Motivator does not apply when a player draws action cards from either of the abilities of the Politics action card, or any other effect outside of the status phase.
  2. Neural Motivator only applies to the Draw Action Card step of the status phase. It does not apply when a player draws action cards due to the effect of the Minister of Policy law or similar effects.

data.name: NewConstitution
data.value: 1. If a player controls planets in another player’s home system, those planets are not exhausted by the “For” outcome of New Constitution.

data.name: NexusSovereignty
data.value:
1. The effect of the Nexus Sovereignty law does not affect the Creuss player.
  2. When the Nexus Sovereignty law is in play, units cannot move through the alpha and beta wormholes in the wormhole nexus, even by effects that move ships outside of the movement step of a tactical action, such as while retreating.
  3. When the Nexus Sovereignty law is in play, hits may still be produced against ships in the active system by units with the Deep Space Cannon ability in systems that are adjacent via a wormhole during the Space Cannon Offense step of a tactical action.
  4. Players may still be neighbors via systems that are adjacent via wormholes.

data.name: OccupyTheFringe
data.value: 1. The Saar player’s Floating Factories are never on a planet.

data.name: OccupyTheSeatOfTheEmpire
OrbitalFoundries
ParadiseWorld
Parley
data.value:
1. If a player commits ground forces to multiple planets, Parley will affect ground forces on only one planet.
  2. The returned ground forces cannot be committed to another planet during the same tactical action.

data.name: PatrolVastTerritories
data.value:
1. The number of units in the system is irrelevant, if there is at least one.
  2. A system that contains a planet destroyed by the Stellar Converter relic, and no other planets, is considered to contain no planets.

data.name: Plagiarize
data.value:
1. A player cannot play Plagiarize if they have less than five influence available.
  2. A player does not need to meet the prerequisites of the technology they gain from Plagiarize.
  3. The active player must announce which technology they are gaining before other players decide whether to play a Sabotage.
  4. If a faction has a faction–specific unit upgrade as one of their faction technologies, they cannot use Plagiarize to gain that unit upgrade.
    1. If a player’s neighbor owns a faction–specific unit upgrade, it cannot be chosen in order to gain the generic version of that unit upgrade by using Plagiarize.

data.name: Plague
data.value: 1. A planet with zero infantry on it may be targeted by Plague.

data.name: PlasmaScoring
data.value:
1. Only one additional dice is rolled for each bombardment or space cannon roll, regardless of how many units are using that ability.
    1. During an invasion in a system with multiple planets, only one unit will add a dice to its bombardment roll.
    2. During an invasion, if ground forces have been committed to multiple planets, Plasma Scoring will add an additional dice to the space cannon rolls for each planet during the Space Cannon Defense step.

data.name: PoliticalCensure
data.value: 1. When a player is elected for Political Censure, they may play the Confusing Legal Text or Deadly Plot action cards before it resolves.

data.name: PoliticalSecret
data.value:
1. A player may still use abilities from their faction technology, leaders, or mechs after their Political Secret has been played.
    1. If a player has had their Political Secret played, other players may still use that player’s other promissory notes.
  2. If an agenda is discarded, each Political Secret that has been played is returned. The affected players may vote on the next agenda as normal.
  3. The effect of Political Secret does not stop a player from using their passive faction ability, only the abilities that player may choose to use.

data.name: PoliticalStability
data.value:
1. During the upcoming agenda phase, all abilities stay resolved in speaker order, not initiative order.
  2. The strategy cards are readied when Political Stability is played.
  3. The “Return Strategy Cards” step is the last step of the status phase. All other steps must be completed by all players before Political Stability may be played. This includes scoring and revealing objectives, drawing action cards (and discarding down to hand limit, if necessary), and gaining and redistributing command tokens.
    1. If a player draws Political Stability during the status phase, they may play it during the same phase.

data.name: PoliticsRider
data.value:
1. After playing a Politics Rider, a player may use additional abilities, including playing other rider cards.
    1. Any other riders may be played to predict the same or a different outcome.
  2. The effect of a successful Politics Rider will be resolved after the effect of the agenda.
  3. A player who cannot vote may still play a Politics Rider.

data.name: PopulateTheOuterRim
data.value:
1. The number of units in the system is irrelevant, if there is at least one.
  2. A ship, ground force, or structure will all qualify for Populate the Outer Rim.
    1. If one player has a ground force or structure on a planet in a qualifying system, and another player has a ship in the same system, both players may count the system towards the requirements of Populate the Outer Rim.
  3. The units may be in another player’s home system.
  4. The Creuss Gate is not a home system.
  5. The Wormhole Nexus and the Creuss home system are both on the edge of the game board.
  6. If the edge of a system tile is touching a hyperlane tile, that edge does not cause that system tile to be on the edge of the game board.
    1. When using the five– and seven–player hyperlane setups, the system tile in the center of the ring of hyperlanes is not on the edge of the game board.
    2. When using the seven– and eight–player alternate setups, only the system tiles designated as “Ring 3” and home systems are on the edge of the game board, along with the Creuss home system and the wormhole nexus.

data.name: PredictiveIntelligence
data.value:
1. Neither ability of Predictive Intelligence may be used if it is exhausted.
  2. If a player removes any tokens from their fleet pool, they will need to meet their new fleet pool limits before any other effects may resolve.

data.name: ProduceEnMasse
data.value: 1. The number of units in the system is irrelevant, if there is at least one.

data.name: ProphecyOfIxth
data.value: 1. Other effects that produce units without a unit using its Production ability will not cause Prophecy of Ixth to be discarded.

data.name: PropulsionResearchFacility
ProtectTheBorder
data.value:
1. The number of structures on the planet is irrelevant, if there is at least one.
  2. The structures may be on planets in another player’s home system.
  3. The Saar player’s Floating Factories cannot be used to score Protect the Border.

data.name: ProveEndurance
data.value: 1. Prove Endurance is scored when the player passes during the action phase. They may then score another secret objective in the status phase immediately following.

data.name: Psychoarchaeology
data.value:
1. When researching a technology, each planet with a technology speciality can only be used to ignore a single prerequisite.
  2. Exhausting planets to gain trade goods can be done at any time during action phase, except when another ability is being resolved. For example, if a player has one of their planets with a technology specialty targeted with the Uprising action card, they cannot use Psychoarchaeology in response to gain a trade good.
  3. If multiple planets are exhausted, the trade goods are gained one at a time.

data.name: PublicDisgrace
data.value:
1. If the originally chosen strategy card has trade goods on it, those will not be taken if Public Disgrace is played.
  2. Public Disgrace may only be played during the regular choosing of a strategy card during the strategy phase. It cannot be played when other effects cause a player to take a strategy card, such as the Imperial Arbiter agenda.

data.name: PublicExecution
PublicizeWeaponSchematics
data.value:
1. If the Publicize Weapon Schematics law is in play, and a player is the first to gain the war sun unit upgrade technology, from then on, prerequisites for the war sun unit upgrade technology will be ignored.
  2. If the Muaat does not own their Prototype War Sun II faction unit upgrade technology, they do not own a war sun technology.
    1. If the Publicize Weapon Schematics law is in play, the Muaat player will not cause prerequisites for the War Sun unit upgrade technology to be ignored if they do not own their Prototype War Sun II faction unit upgrade technology.
    2. If the “Against” outcome of Publicize Weapon Schematics is resolved, the Muaat player will not discard their action cards if they do not own their Prototype War Sun II faction unit upgrade technology.
  3. The Muaat player’s Prototype War Sun will lose its Sustain Damage ability, regardless of if the Muaat player owns their Prototype War Sun II faction unit upgrade technology.

data.name: PushBoundaries
data.value: 1. If a player has units or controls a planet in a system containing an alpha wormhole, and the Creuss player has units or controls a planet in a system containing a beta wormhole, or vice versa, those two players are neighbors.

data.name: RaiseAFleet
Rally
ReactorMeltdown
data.value:
1. A player cannot destroy their own space dock with Reactor Meltdown.
  2. At least one space dock belonging to another player must exist on the game board in a non–home system for a player to play and resolve Reactor Meltdown.
  3. If a player owns a space dock in another player’s home system, that space dock cannot be targeted by Reactor Meltdown.
    1. A space dock in an eliminated player’s home system cannot be targeted.

data.name: RearmamentAgreement
data.value:
1. A player that controls no planets in their home system will not place a mech if the “For” outcome of Rearmament Agreement is resolved.
  2. If a player wishes to place a mech, but there are none in their reinforcements, they may remove a mech from any system that does not contain one of their command tokens and place that instead. The mech will be placed undamaged.
  3. A player that has no mechs on the game board is unaffected by the “Against” effect of Rearmament Agreement.

data.name: ReclaimAncientMonuments
data.value: 1. The number of attachments a planet has is irrelevant, if it has at least one.

data.name: RefitTroops
data.value:
1. A player must have at least one infantry on the game board to play and resolve Refit Troops.
  2. If a player has no mechs left in their reinforcements, they may remove a mech from any system that does not contain one of their command tokens and place that instead. The mech will be placed undamaged.

data.name: ReflectiveShielding
data.value:
1. If Reflective Shielding is played after a ship uses its Sustain Damage ability during an Assign Hits step, then the hits produced by Reflective Shielding are added to any other hits produced in the immediately proceeding Roll Dice step.
    1. A unit that used its Sustain Damage ability to cancel some of those other hits, and been repaired, cannot use its Sustain Damage ability again to cancel the hits produced by Reflective Shielding.
  2. If Reflective Shielding is played after a ship uses its Sustain Damage ability at any other time during combat (for example, when the Creuss player uses their Dimensional Splicer faction technology ability), the hits are assigned immediately.

data.name: RegulatedConscription
Reparations
data.value:
1. Reparations may be played by a player with no exhausted planets, or when they lose control of a planet to a player with no readied planets.
    1. Reparations cannot be played by a player with no exhausted planets when they lose control of a planet to a player with no readied planets.

data.name: RepealLaw
data.value: 1. There must be at least one law in play for a player to play and resolve Repeal Law.

data.name: RepresentativeGovernment
RepresentativeGovernmentProphecyOfKings
ResearchGrantReallocation
data.value:
1. A player may gain any technology, regardless of the number of command tokens in their fleet pool.
    1. If a player must remove more command tokens than they have in their fleet pool, they remove all their command tokens from their fleet pool instead.

data.name: ResearchTeamBiotic
data.value: 1. The agenda card, not the planet, is exhausted to ignore the prerequisite.
